Annotation.String: Uniquely identifies the resource within the collection of like resources.
This property represents an identifier for the resource. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
Provides a description of this resource and is used for commonality in the schema definitions.
This object represents the Description property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
The name of the resource or array element.

This object represents the Name property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification. The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Name*.
Oem extension object.
This object represents the Oem property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
Oem extension object.
This object represents the Oem properties. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
Base type for an Oem object.
This object represents the base type for an Oem property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
This is the base type for resources and referenceable members.
This is the manufacturer/provider specific extension moniker used to divide the Oem object into sections.
The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Oem*.
This indicates the known state of the resource, such as if it is enabled.

This property shall represent if this component is available or not and why. Enabled indicates the resource is available. Disabled indicates the resource has been intentionally made unavailable but it can be enabled. Offline indicates the resource is unavailable intentionally and requires action to be made available. InTest indicates that the component is undergoing testing. Starting indicates that the resource is on its way to becoming available. Absent indicates the resources is physically unavailable.
This represents the overall health state from the view of this resource.
This property shall represent the HealthState of the resource and its dependent resources. The values shall conform to those defined in the Redfish specification.
This represents the health state of this resource in the absence of its dependent resources.
This property shall represent the HealthState of the resource without considering its dependent resources. The values shall conform to those defined in the Redfish specification.
This function or resource has been enabled
This function or resource has been disabled
This function or resource is enabled, but awaiting an external action to activate it
This function or resource is part of a redundancy set and is awaiting a failover or other external action to activate it.
This function or resource is undergoing testing
This function or resource is starting
This function or resource is not present or not detected
A condition exists that requires attention
A critical condition exists that requires immediate attention
Turn the system on
Turn the system off immediately (non-graceful) shutdown
Perform a graceful system shutdown and power off
Perform a graceful system shutdown followed by a restart of the system
Perform an immediate (non-graceful) shutdown, followed by a restart of the system
Generate a Diagnostic Interrupt (usually an NMI on x86 systems) to cease normal operations, perform diagnostic actions and typically halt the system.
Turn the system on immediately
Simulate the pressing of the physical power button on this system
This is the base type for addressable members of an array.

Array members can be referenced using the value returned in the @odata.id property which may or may not be a dereferenceable URL. The @odata.id of this entity shall be the location of this element within an Item.
This is the identifier for the member within the collection.
The value of this string shall uniquely identify the member within the collection.
This is the manufacturer/provider specific extension moniker used to divide the Oem object into sections.
The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Oem*.
This indicates the world wide, persistent name of the resource.
This property shall contain the world wide unique identifier for the resource. The string shall be in the format described by the value of the Identifier.DurableNameFormat property
This represents the format of the DurableName property.
This property shall represent the format of the DurableName property.
Name Address Authority Format
This durable name shall be a hexadecimal representation of the Name Address Authority structure as defined in the T10 SCSI Primary Commands specification.
iSCSI Qualified Name
This durable name shall be in the iSCSI Qualified Name format as defined in RFC 3720 and RFC 3721.
Fibre Channel World Wide Name
This durable name shall be a hexadecimal representation of the World Wide Name format as defined in the T11 Fibre Channel Physical and Signaling Interface Specification.
Universally Unique Identifier

This durable name shall be the hexadecimal representation of the Universal Unique Identifier as defined in the Internation Telecom Union's OSI networking and system aspects - Naming, Addressing and Registration Specification.
